transcription.text: These were the television shows that became a part of our family, like relatives that came by to visit a few nights a week. There were hosts that audiences loved, guests they often didn't and formats so recognisable they felt like a warm blanket. Board game versions of our most popular quiz shows were another way these programmes embedded themselves in our lives. The games allowed us to imagine finding a romantic partner on Perfect Match or walking away with cash prizes on The Price Is Right. Even as game-show formats changed on the small screen, the version inside the box lived on.
